The game "One-Armed Pirate" is a game of chance with 32 cards.
Each player puts their stake in the pot and is given 5 cards, which the other player cannot see.
First, each player must call the number of points they think they can win, where each trick won equals one point.
The player who calls the higher number of points leads the game and decides the trump suit.
He must now try to win at least that number of points.
The player who leads plays his first card and the other player must follow by playing a card of the same suit, if he can.
The player with the highest card wins the point.
If a player cannot follow suit, he can discard any card or play a trump card.
The sequence of the cards is I, II, III, IV, Pirate, Bride, Governor, Parrot.
A trump card beats all other cards.
The player who has won the point plays the next card.
You continue like this until someone wins the game.
If the leader succeeds in winning the number of points he called, he wins the game and takes the pot.
If he doesn't, his opponent wins.
